conclusion: The area of the coil ABCO is 0.4 m² and the magnetic induction intensity of the uniform magnetic field is B = 0.1 T.
The magnetic field direction is along the positive x-axis.
The coil ABCO is initially positioned such that its plane is perpendicular to the x-axis.

premise: The plane of the coil is perpendicular to the x-axis.
conclusion: The initial magnetic flux is Φ_initial = B × S = 0.1 × 0.4 = 0.04 Wb.
The coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.

premise: After rotating 60° downward, the plane of the coil becomes inclined to the x-axis.
conclusion: The final magnetic flux is Φ_final = B × S × cos(60°) = 0.1 × 0.4 × 0.5 = 0.02 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux is ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial = 0.02 - 0.04 = -0.02 Wb.

premise: The negative sign indicates a decrease in magnetic flux.
conclusion: The magnetic flux changes by 0.02 Wb.
